title: The substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction is called a
feedback: Products are the substances formed as a result of a chemical reaction. In a chemical equation, products are listed on the right side, indicating the new substances produced.

title: The law that states mass is neither created nor destroyed in a chemical reaction is known as
feedback: The Law of Conservation of Mass states that mass is neither created nor destroyed in a chemical reaction. It means the mass of the reactants equals the mass of the products.

title: A type of chemical bond formed by the sharing of electrons between atoms is called a
feedback: A covalent bond is a type of chemical bond that involves the sharing of electron pairs between atoms. These electron pairs are known as shared pairs or bonding pairs, and the stable balance of attractive and repulsive forces between atoms when they share electrons is known as covalent bonding.
